location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.223B of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is a covering letter for two enclosures, the first of which is a translated copy of a letter received by Hennell from the Sultan of Muscat Syed Toweynee [Thuwaini bin Said], dated 14 April 1850, the second from Syed Ges ben Azan, Governor of Sohar [Suhar], dated 9 May 1850. Both enclosures relate to the incarceration of Said Hamood bin Azan of Suhar by Thuwaini bin Said, and Azan's subsequent death.
